Common definitions of terrorism refer only to those violent acts that are intended to create fear (terror); are perpetrated for a religious, political, or ideological goal; and deliberately target or disregard the safety of non-combatants (e.g., neutral military personnel or civilians). Some definitions now include acts of unlawful violence and war. Wikipedia.

This is NOT the defeat of Fast-Track, yet...They are bringing TAA up for a re-vote on Monday or Tuesday, and if that passes, the whole thing goes through as planned. So it's very important that everyone keep calling/emailing their reps in the House and tell them to vote NO on TAA.
